item.description:
Welcome Our Troops return home from overseas.

Monday Sept. 5th., 12:30 PM.  Noon time, not midnight.

Pease International Airport. Portsmouth / Newington NH.

If you think you wish to attend? Please sign up at:

http://www.peasegreeters.org/    ; Flights change so often and they will keep you informed.

  Believe it Folks!  We have a flight of Troops Coming Home!

Flight arrives at 1:30 pm.  But, we need to be there, before they land.This is because flights are early or late, or canceled some times. The Pease Greeters web site will want to give  notice of changes. They will also give you a short tour, and explain to you what will happen. So again, please sign up online with the Pease Greeters.   Pease International Airport. Portsmouth / Newington NH.

Host: Steve Obermiller. 603-491-1962 ob@tds.net Carpooling from Nashua and Manchester NH.

Please sign up online for the Pease Greeters emails. Flights are subject to change, delay or cancelation.

The Pease Greeters Flight Alert Channel Your source for the latest flight information updated daily. Hotline (603) 766 0502 New Schedule - Flights Added, Deleted & Time Changes The schedule has been updated to include the addition of flights, the deletion of one flight and times changes to two flights.    Arrival:
 The schedule is as follows. 
Date                      Day                  Time                 Direction                  flight#  #troops  9-05-11               Monday            1:30  PM             Coming Home              11         425 9-05-11               Someday          1:30  PM             Coming Home              12         426

     Please join and meet Steve O. and friends for an hour or two at the Pease Air Terminal. We will welcome home about 425 returning troops, from their latest overseas tour of duty. The troops have no idea anyone is at the airport waiting to welcome them. They are expecting just another empty airport. Where, maybe they can get something to eat out of a machine, or use a pay phone to call home. Flights land here for only an hour or so, to refuel and change crews. Before they tack off again to return to their homes and bases throughout our country. Most of the the troops landing in NH. are not from New England. This will be the first time they have set foot in the USA.. Most of the troops feel they are not sure yet. If they are coming home in a seat or a box. Until they first land back in the USA.. When Steve O. returned from his oversea tours. He was welcome home the first time. The second and third times, he was given the cold treatment, and no one was there at all. So, now that we have learned to support our troops, and not to blame them for a bad war. Steve O. would like your help, in giving these brave men and women. A warm New england thanks and welcome them home. Please sign up online for the Pease Greeters emails. Flights are subject to change or delay. They will let you know where and when the flights are arriving. They will also let you know, if the flights are late or early. Most of the flights are usually on weekday late nights or early morning. So, Steve O. has been reluctant to ask people to join him to welcome past flights. But, this is a weekday and not too late or too early. So, join us. Steve O. has attended this event before, and found it more than worth the time.

More info. below: Directions from Boston: Take Interstate 95 North into New Hampshire, continuing through the Hampton Toll Booth towards Portsmouth. Take Exit 3 Portsmouth/Greenland to the stoplight. Take left onto Rt 33, at the next light you will see a sign for Pease International Tradeport, take a right at the light onto Grafton Drive. Not the Air National Guard air terminal.

Copyright © Pease Greeters Fund, Inc. 2010. All rights reserved Contact the Postmaster at Pease.Greeters@hotmail.com. To make a tax deductible donation contact Ed Johnson at (603) 964-5929 or e-mail at captedmun@aol.com. You may also mail your contributions to Pease Greeters, P O box 178, Rye Beach, NH 03871
